posts.name: Tharun Kumar
posts.cooked: We are planning to add the pid hold command on our elevator. I have all the algorithms ready, but I can’t find a command to hold the elevator using pid. We are using magic motion to move and pid to hold the elevator, the pid is holding the elevator strong but I know that there is a command for it, can anyone tell me that’s command and how to use it?

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked:
What motors are you using on this elevator?

Typically all you need to keep the elevator at a given position is a basic PIDController with enough P gain and maybe a Feedforward. Brake mode enabled on the motor/controller helps too.
given the fact that they are using magic motion (probably meant motion magic) I’d assume a falcon but I could be wrong.

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
Motion Magic will hold the elevator once it reaches the set point. You don’t need a different command for that.

Do you have feed-forward? Can you share your code?

posts.name: UnofficialForth
posts.cooked:
It sounds like you are talking specifically about a Setpoint Command , which is used in conjunction with a PIDSubsystem.

However: If you already have a PID that is working and all it needs is its setpoint updated, you can just do that in the initialization portion of a command. 5613 has a couple of different positions: image 1003×488 26.2 KB (Side note: Yoink is a genius alternative to using the word “intake” as both a noun and verb everywhere in code, you can’t change my mind)

image 1003×488 26.2 KB

image 1003×488 26.2 KB
